question: A snail is climbing a slippery slope. Will it reach the top before nightfall, or will it slide back down?
Two bakers are making cookies. Does the first baker make more cookies than the second baker or the second baker make more cookies than the first baker?
A boat is sailing on a lake. Will it encounter a friendly dolphin or a grumpy turtle?
Two squirrels are racing to bury a nut. Will the gray squirrel bury the nut before the red squirrel, or the red squirrel bury the nut first?
A kite is flying high in the sky. Will it get tangled in a tree, or continue to soar freely?
Two artists are painting the same sunset. Will the first artist use more red than yellow, or will the second artist use more yellow than red?
A frog is hopping across lily pads. Will it reach the other side of the pond, or fall into the water?
Two ants are carrying crumbs. Will the first ant carry a larger crumb than the second ant, or will the second ant carry a crumb larger than the first?
A bird is building a nest. Will it choose a branch high in the tree or close to the ground?
Two children are drawing with crayons. Will the first child draw a picture of a cat, or will the second child draw a picture of a dog?
A paper airplane is launched from a window. Will it land on the roof of a house or in a garden?
Two children are picking strawberries. Will the first child pick riper strawberries than the second child, or the second child pick riper strawberries than the first?
A balloon is released into the air. Will it float towards the mountains or the sea?
Two cats are chasing a laser pointer. Will the gray cat catch it first, or will the orange cat be faster?
A child is planting a seed. Will it grow into a sunflower or a daisy?
Two friends are knitting scarves. Will the first friend finish their scarf first, or will the second friend be quicker?
A raindrop is falling from the sky. Will it land on a flower or a leaf?
Two chefs are baking cakes. Will the first chef's cake be taller, or the second chef's cake be wider?
A butterfly is fluttering around a garden. Will it land on a pink flower or a yellow flower?
Two dogs are playing fetch. Will the small dog catch the ball first, or will the big dog be quicker?
A hiker is climbing a mountain. Will they reach a rocky peak or a grassy plateau?
Two painters are painting doors. Will the first painter paint a darker shade of green than the second painter, or will the second painter paint a lighter shade of blue than the first?
A paper boat is floating down a stream. Will it pass under a bridge or get caught on a rock?
Two children are skipping rope. Will the first child skip higher than the second child, or will the second child skip longer than the first?
A star is shining in the night sky. Will it twinkle brighter than all the others, or fade away before dawn?
Two musicians are playing guitars. Will the first musician play a faster tempo than the second musician, or the second musician play a melody that is more somber?
A leaf is falling from a tree. Will it twirl to the left or to the right?
Two gardeners are planting flowers. Will the first gardener's flowers bloom sooner or the second gardeners flowers grow taller?
A cloud is drifting across the sky. Will it turn into a sheep or a dragon?
Two bakers are decorating cakes. Will the first baker use more frosting than the second baker, or will the second baker use more sprinkles than the first?
A firefly is blinking in the darkness. Will it fly up or fly down?
Two birds are singing in a tree. Will the first bird sing louder than the second bird, or the second birds song sound more cheerful?
A pebble is dropped into a pond. Will the ripples reach the edge of the pond, or fade away before they get there?
Two friends are playing chess. Will the first friend capture the others queen or lose the game first?
A bubble is floating in the air. Will it pop on a sharp thorn or drift away on the breeze?
Two cooks are making soup. Will the first cook make a more spicy soup than the second cook, or the second cook make a more creamy soup?
A spider is spinning a web. Will it catch a fly or a moth?
Two farmers are harvesting apples. Will the first farmer pick more red apples or the second farmer pick more green apples?
A snail is crawling on a rock. Will it leave a slimy trail on a wet surface or dry surface?
Two artists are sculpting clay. Will the first artist sculpt an animal or the second artist sculpt a human figure?
A ladybug is crawling on a leaf. Will it fly away or continue crawling?
Two dancers are performing on stage. Will the first dancer jump higher than the second dancer, or the second dancers routine be more elegant?
A stream is flowing through a forest. Will it merge into a larger river or disappear into the ground?
Two authors are writing books. Will the first author finish the novel faster than the second author write more chapters?
A mushroom is growing in a forest. Will it be poisonous or edible?
Two singers are performing a duet. Will the first singer have the higher pitch, or will the second singer deliver more emotionally charged lyrics?
A dandelion seed is floating in the wind. Will it land on fertile soil or barren ground?
Two tailors are sewing garments. Will the first tailor use more silk or the second tailor use more linen?
An egg is sitting in a nest. Will it hatch into a bird or remain unhatched?
Two actors are rehearsing scenes. Will the first actor laugh more on scene, or will the second actor cry more in act?
A feather is floating in a room. Will it float towards a light source or a dark corner?
Two dancers are waltzing across a floor. Will the first dancer be more elegant or will the second dancer be more joyful?
A candle is burning in a room. Will the candle last throughout the whole night, or will it run out?
Two magicians are performing on stage. Will the first magician perform a more complex trick or the second magician have a greater stage presence?
A balloon is tied to a chair. Will it pop or remain inflated?
Two designers are creating projects. Will the first designer have a more innovative creation or the second designer have a more efficient creation?
A snowflake is falling from the sky. Will it land on a coat sleeve or melt instantly?
Two storytellers are sharing tales. Will the first storyteller weave a narrative that is more thrilling or will the second storyteller deliver a tale that is more profound?
A ball is rolling down a hill. Will it reach the bottom or stop before it gets there?
Two poets are writing verses. Will the first poet produce verses that are more lyrical or the second poet produce verses that are more evocative?
A painting hangs on a wall. Will it sell for a high price or receive less attention?
Two architects are designing buildings. Will the first architect design a building with unique aesthetics or the second architect design a building with sustainable functionality?
A glass sits on a table. Will it fall or remain stable?
Two programmers are debugging the code. Will the first programmer find the bug that causes a program to crash the easiest or the second programmer find the bug causing the most memory?
A key is sitting on a table. Will the person in the room lock the door or unlock the door?
Two comedians are performing in front of an audience. Will the first comedian win over more people or the second comedian to produce a performance that is less funny?
A clock is ticking. Will it tell the right time or will it run out?
Two analysts are creating reports. Will the first analyst create a less complex report but more in depth, or the second Analyst produce a more complex report but less in depth?
options: First Analyst (less complex more in depth)
Second Analyst (more complex less in depth)
